type: Riparian Planting for Slope Stabilization \\u2013 Bar U Ranch National Historic Site, AB
full_summary:
=====================================


**Riparian Planting for Slope Stabilization - Bar U Ranch National Historic Site, Alberta**
------------------------------------------------------------

### Tender Notice

**Reference Number**: cb-462-51417689
**Solicitation Number**: 5P420-23-0212/A
**Publication Date**: February 7, 2024
**Tender Closing Date**: March 12, 2024, at 16:00 MST

**Bidder Information**

Parks Canada invites bidders to submit proposals for the riparian planting and slope stabilization work at the Bar U Ranch National Historic Site in Alberta. The work involves the supply and installation of plants, as well as the construction of temporary fencing to protect the plants from wildlife.

### Requirement

The contract period will start on the date of contract award and end on September 30, 2024. An optional extension of one year from October 1, 2024, to September 30, 2025, is available.

### Disclaimer

Parks Canada advises bidders that they are not currently accepting bids via SAP Ariba. Bidders must submit their bids via fax or email as specified in the solicitation document. Bids submitted in-person or by courier will not be accepted.

### Site Visit

A site visit will be held at the Bar U Ranch National Historic Site on February 15, 2024. Bidders must confirm attendance and provide the names of attendees to the Contracting Authority by February 14, 2024, at 14:00 MST.

### Enquiries

Enquiries regarding the bid solicitation must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority and received prior to seven days before the tender closing date. Late enquiries may not receive a response.

### Documents

Bidders can obtain bid documents from the Government Electronic Tendering Service at [http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities](http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities). Addenda will be available from this website.

### Government of Canada Tendering Service

The Government of Canada has made every effort to provide equivalent documents in both official languages. Bidders are advised to notify the Contracting Authority of any discrepancies between the English and French documents.

### Routing of Bids

Bids must be routed through the specified email (soumissionsouestbidswest@canada.ca) or fax number (1-866-246-6893). Bids submitted by other means may not
